a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Generic chart title to silence errors
Percentage of 15-year-old male and female students scoring higher than 669 on the PISA mathematics scale (i.e.
scoring at level 6). For reference, the metric for the overall mathematics scale is based on a mean for OECD
countries of 500 points and a standard deviation of 100 points.
PISA: Female 15-year-olds by mathematics proficiency level (%). Level 6
PISA: Male 15-year-olds by mathematics proficiency level (%).
Source: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA)
